data.title: Queen Charlotte of Mexico
data.meta_description: A bust-length illustrated portrait of Carlota, Empress of Mexico, previously Charlotte of Belgium, turned partially to the left. She is wearing a large crown and an ermine wrap. Her hair lies in two curls, one on either side of her head, she is wearing earrings, and there is a broach at the front of her dress. "Photographie ; Charlet & Jacotin ; 37, Boult. de Strasbourg ; Paris." stamped in black on the verso.Title from verso. Carlota was the wife of Emperor Maximilian of Mexico, who ruled from 1864 to 1867. Maximilian was the son of Austrian Archduke Franz Karl and the younger brother of Emperor Franz Joseph of Austria.
